entry.title: Collaborated with Facebook: what I have learned from this one-year project
entry.content:
By the end of September, my project funded by Facebook Reality Lab has come to an end. With our recent submission, I believe that our collaboration is making a promising progress. I am really happy to be part of this collaboration and I sincerely thank my supervisor Dr. Radu Horaud for offering me this precious oppotuniry. During this year, I have surely experienced a lot of different things, some are more joyful, others might be less encouraging. By the end of it, it would be a good idea to spend some time to sum up what I have learned from this experience. I hope that it can help me to have a better organization for my recently started PhD.

First impression

Pros

Cons

My thoughts

entry.title: My first post
entry.content:
Welcome to my world! Due to some technical issues with the server that I purchased, I, infortunately, lost all the data from my previous website.

Since I will start my PhD next month (October 2021), it is a good time to restart from zero. Let‚Äôs hope that this new website can ‚Äòreborn from the ashes‚Äô.

This website is hosted by GitHub Pages, with a custom doamin that I chose for myself. Blogs are based on the Hexo framework, a fast, simple & powerful tool for blog writing.

Organization

I hope to organize the blogs as follows:

  1. Basic information about myself: background, research interests, contacts
  2. Research progress about the PhD
  3. Technical posts about Computer Vision, Incremental Learning, etc.
  4. Casual sharing about my life

I am really looking forward to this new journey of PhD. Hope that it would become a fruitful experience by the end of it.

Please feel free to contact me!

entry.title: research
entry.content:
News

-> 2021 October I joined the Thoth team as a PhD student under the supervision of Karteek Alahari üî•
-> 2021 September Funded by Facebook Reality Lab, my one-year project about Visually-asisted speech processing came to an happy ending. üëè

Publications

Preprints:

Kang, Zhiqi, Mostafa Sadeghi, and Radu Horaud. ‚ÄúFace Frontalization Based on Robustly Fitting a Deformable Shape Model to 3D Landmarks.‚Äù arXiv preprint arXiv:2010.13676 (2020).

Conference papers:

Kang, Zhiqi, Radu Horaud, and Mostafa Sadeghi. ‚ÄúRobust Face Frontalization For Visual Speech Recognition.‚Äù International Conference on Computer Vision Workshops. 2021.

Kang, Zhiqi, et al. ‚ÄúUnderstanding political communication styles in televised debates via body movements.‚Äù European Conference on Computer Vision Workshops. Springer, Cham, 2020.
